questions.question: If a customer does not like the way reconciliation runs or calculates compliance, it is okay to modify the scripts includes, business rules and other logic to accommodate the business requirement.

comments.content: I don't think it's an option to "not like the way reconciliation is run". If the user believes there are errors, raise a Hi ticket.

questions.question: By default, which ServiceNow role can view reconciliation results?

comments.content:
From the course:
Users with the sam_admin role can run on-demand reconciliation; users with sam_user role can only view reconciliation results.

questions.question: The process of determining compliance by comparing software rights owned with normalized software installations discovered is __________________ .

comments.content: -	Reconciliation: calculates the compliance status of software products with respect to discovered installations and defined software models and entitlements.

Software reconciliation is an automated process that calculates compliance based on how many rights are in use compared to the number of active rights purchased. It keeps license positions accurate and up to date without manual calculations.

questions.question: The definition for _________________ in the Reconciliation Product result is: “Estimated cost of remediating non-compliance based on the least number of rights needed.”

comments.content:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-service-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/t_ViewSWModelResultsSAMF.html

True-up cost:	Estimated cost of remediating non-compliance based on the least number of rights needed (rights needed * average price per right from entitlements). The lowest cost from Purchase Rights remediation options.

questions.question: When reconciliation is run, a list of product results displays the compliance status of software versions and editions with respect to discovery and entitlements.

comments.content: -	Reconciliation: calculates the compliance status of software products with respect to discovered installations and defined software models and entitlements.
B: Software Model Result shows compliance status based on software version.

Each metric group has a set of license metrics that are specific to the publisher.

You can view the Metric Attributes related list in software models to set the attribute value.

questions.question: What are the four tiers of software reconciliation results? (Choose four.)

comments.content: SOFTWARE METRIC IS RIGHT AND NOT SOFTWARE ALLOCATION

Four tiers of reconciliation results:
-	Software publisher: results for all products and installations associated to the publisher
-	Software product: results for all models and installations associated to the product. Generated after reconciliation, even if there are no software models defined for the product. Displays information such as Software Model Results, Unlicensed Installs, Removal candidates etc.
-	Software model: results for all license metrics related to the software model. Only created when a software model or entitlement exists for the product.
-	License metric: results for each license metric associated to the software model.
Based on SAM Fundamentals

questions.question: When reconciliation is run, what information does the license metric results display?
answers: A. Results for all models and installations associated to the product
B. Results for all products and installations associated to the publisher
C. Results for each license metric associated to the software model
D. Results for all license metrics related to the software model

comments.content:
From the course:
License metric: Results for each license metric associated to the software model

E. Software Asset > Reconciliation > Run License Position Report

When running reconciliation manually, allow enough time for the process to complete. For faster results, narrow the scope by selecting specific publishers.

Procedure

Navigate to All > Software Asset > Reconciliation > Run Reconciliation and select the publishers for which compliance should be calculated, or select all publishers.

questions.question: License metrics can be defined for which of the following? (Choose four.)

comments.content: B, C, D, G is correct - per 194 of the SN SAM Pro text that comes with the course
it fault for users

Six common license metrics:
-	Per Core: licenses cores on a physical server or virtual machine (CPU core count)
-	Per Device: licenses a device for a number of installations of software
-	Per Named Device: licenses a specific device for a number of installations of software
-	Per User: licenses a user for a number of installations of software
-	Per Named User: licenses a specific user for a number of installations of software
-	Per Processor (CPU count): licenses processors on either a physical server or virtual machine
can some put the redeem code for the book ?

B, C, D, G is correct:
"Software license metrics are used for reconciliation to determine your compliance position. License metrics can be defined for users, devices, processors, and cores. What license metrics are available is based on the metric group. Metric groups are either common or tied to a specific software publisher." per the Software Asset Management (SAM) Professional Fundamentals On Demand (Utah) training - Software License Metrics page
BCDG is correct
BCDF is right answer

This should be per Named Device , Option B

Six common license metrics:
-	Per Core: licenses cores on a physical server or virtual machine (CPU core count)
-	Per Device: licenses a device for a number of installations of software
-	Per Named Device: licenses a specific device for a number of installations of software
-	Per User: licenses a user for a number of installations of software
-	Per Named User: licenses a specific user for a number of installations of software
-	Per Processor (CPU count): licenses processors on either a physical server or virtual machine
I agree, this should e B - Per Named Device

questions.question: Which of the following license metrics require allocations in order to maintain compliance? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
C,D
Allocations needed: number of allocations needed for compliance (only used for Per Named User and Per Named Device license metrics)

-	License metric: results for each license metric associated to the software model. License metric rights allocations are calculated for:
o	Allocated in use: software license that is allocated and used to license installations.
o	Not allocated in use: software license that is used to license installations but not allocated.
o	Allocated not in use: software license that is allocated but not used to license installations.
o	Not allocated: number of available rights that have not been allocated (installed or not)
o	Allocations needed: number of allocations needed for compliance (only used for Per Named User and Per Named Device license metrics)
C and D is correct
Correct answer is C and D

questions.question: What product must you procure a separate license for in order to utilize Workflow and Client Software Distribution (CSD) to automatically install software on devices.

comments.content: Orchestration

C
Client software distribution requires the Orchestration - Client Software Distribution plugin (com.snc.orchestration.client_sf_distribution), which is available by request with a subscription to Orchestration.

Full use of CSD requires the Orchestration – Client Software Distribution plugin, which is available by request with a subscription to the ServiceNow’s Orchestration product. Only the revocation/reclamation capability is entitled as part of SAM Pro.
Orchestration

questions.question: Software license management (SLM) is a key component of the software asset lifecycle. What is its primary objective?
answers: A. To convert regular per user licenses into subscription licenses
B. To track, control, and reduce software costs, including costs associated with non-compliance findings during a software audit
C. To reserve a block of licenses for a specific group of users and/or user role(s)
D. To accurately calculate annual true-up cost and total spend on a product
E. To automatically install and remove software on devices using Workflow and Client Software Distribution (CSD)

comments.content:
From the SAM Pro Practical Management Overview section: 

'Software license management (SLM) is a critical component of the software asset lifecycle. Its primary objective is to track, control, and reduce software costs, including costs associated with non-compliance findings during a software audit.'

questions.question: ServiceNow Performance Analytics identifies a trend that use of a certain software package has reduced over time. This is a potential indicator of what?
answers: A. Your company is under-licensed for the product.
B. Your company needs to renegotiate your contract to get better pricing.
C. Your company is over-licensed for the product.
D. Your company needs to retire the unused entitlements.

comments.content: B Your company needs to renegotiate your contract to get better pricing.

questions.question: A(n) ______________ is required for a user or device to consume software rights.

comments.content: Software entitlement refers to the rights and permissions granted for using specific software products.
From SAM on-demand course: Allocations identify a user or device with one or more rights to use a software entitlement.

Licenses define the number of users, devices, or instances that can use the software. Entitlements drive the level of access each of your users have to software.
e.g. a company purchases a software license for the right to use 50 seats of a software product. The software entitlement specifies the machines and/or users to which those 50 licensed seats are assigned.

Licenses define the number of users, devices, or instances that can use the software. Entitlements drive the level of access each of your users have to software.
e.g. a company purchases a software license for the right to use 50 seats of a software product. The software entitlement specifies the machines and/or users to which those 50 licensed seats are assigned.
I think it's A.

questions.question: Which of the following is required to identify users and devices that have the right to use software?

comments.content: From SAM on-demand course: Allocations identify a user or device with one or more rights to use a software entitlement

questions.question: When importing entitlements, a record generates the error, “Publisher Part Number not found”. However, the record is for an expired entitlement that is no longer needed. Which is the best UI action to select?

comments.content:
Option [C] Create PPN and option [A] Create Entitlement do not make sense as we clearly do NOT want that entitlement. 

Now, option [B] Delete is a valid UI Action, while option [D] Reject does not exist as a UI Action. What exists, however, is "Ignore". With that said, i'd go for Delete, unless Ignore is introduced as a valid option.
C Correct Answer per page 77 of SAM Fundamentals.  When a PPN is not found a customer can add a PPN to the library or specify the software model so that the software entitlement can be created.
replies: B should be answer : A customer can add PPN to the library and create entitlement OR Delete record if it is not needed. therefore in this scenario B

questions.question: Which of the following describes Practical Management within the capability blueprint?
answers: A. Improve management controls and drive immediate benefits.
B. Know what you have so you can manage it.
C. Improve efficiency and effectiveness through integration with other areas, such as request, procurement, and IT Service Management.

comments.content:
1
Trustworthy Data: Know what you have so you can manage your assets.

2
Practical Management: Improvement management controls and drive immediate benefits

3
Operational Integration: Improve the efficient and effectiveness through integration with other areas, such as request, procurement and IT Service Management.

4
Strategic Conformance: Achieve best in-class.

From the course:
Practical Management: Improvement management controls and drive immediate benefits

questions.question: Blacklisted candidates are ______________ .
answers: A. Software installations that are not normalized
C. Software installations not allowed in the network environment
D. Software installations with low usage

comments.content: The answer is C - Blacklisted software is the same as Restricted software and it's software not allowed in the environment.  From page 393 in the SN SAM pro text from the course.
C- Blacklisted software is software that isn't allowed to be in the network environment.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a core Software Asset Management function?

comments.content: Shouldn't this be A Financial management ?

Do you think the answer is C?
Core functions of SAM:
Software reconciliation 
- The process of producing a compliance position by comparing the number of software rights acquired against the normalized software inventory
Software reclamation 
- The process of identifying unused software and uninstalling it so that the software rights for the user or device can be repurposed
Software Spend 
- The ServiceNow Software Spend Detection application enables you to track, analyze, and optimize IT software spending from imported financial data.
A - Financial management is not a SAM function. Financial data can be imported for Change projection etc ~ SAM on-demand course

I agree Financial Management - A.  Per SAM Fundamentals - SAM facilitates the tracking, evolution, and management of software license rights, compliance and optimization.  Which my interpretation is  License rights = Rights allocation, Compliance = Inventory Managment, Optimization = reclamation.  No where does it say financial management.
I actually would like to update my answer to "D - Inventory Management": https://www.servicenow.com/products/it-asset-management/what-is-inventory-management.html

Looking at the Asset Workspace, there is a lot of inventory and financial management. Allocation happens at/after procurement. Reclamation is not required, but should be happening for products, therefore I vote B, Reclamation. You have to do all else, but reclamation is not required.

questions.question: In addition to creating a new purchase order for software licenses, additional remediation options are available in Software Model results to: (Choose two.)

A & C.

In addition to creating a purchase order for new software licenses, additional remediation options are available in software model results. Use the results to automatically create and remove allocations, remove unallocated installs, and remove unlicensed installs.
A & C. B&D don't exist as remediation  options.
A and C

query table "samp_remediation_option"  with "display_name=per user" or "display_name=per device"   group by "remediation_action"

When software models are Not Compliant there are 4 remediation options available:

Create Allocations
Remove Allocations

questions.question: Which of the following reasons could apply when a remediation option has an ‘In Progress’ status? (Choose two.)
answers: A. Workflow(s) or process(es) have been initiated to allocate software rights
B. Rights are now available and can be consumed during reconciliation
C. Workflow(s) or process(es) have been initiated to purchase software rights
D. Workflow(s) or process(es) have been initiated to harvest software rights
E. Customer instance is pending updates to CDS Server

questions.question:
Which stage of the software asset lifecycle includes all of the following steps?
Discovering software in the environment
Normalizing installed software to standards
Reconciling entitlements to discovered software
Remediating detected variances

comments.content: The answer is B - Manage - Primary activities in Manage include discovering software in the environment, normalizing installed software to standard, reconciling entitlements to discovered software and remediating detected variances.  From page 15 in the text book included in the SN SAM Pro course.

From the course:
The Manage stage encompasses activities to ensure the organization is compliant and can quickly respond to a software audit. Primary activities in Manage include discovering software in the environment, normalizing installed software to standards, reconciling entitlements to discovered software, and remediating detected variances

questions.question: Which catalog provides a listing of goods offered or available by a third party?

comments.content: D is correct.

questions.question: A software model can have up to how many catalog items?

comments.content:
From the course:

Keep the following in mind when working with catalogs:

A software catalog is part of a service catalog.
A product catalog item can be linked to multiple service catalogs and vendor catalog items or to a single model.
A model can only have one product catalog item.
A vendor catalog item can only have a single product catalog item.

questions.question:
HOTSPOT -
Define the three catalogs that support the request and procurement process.

comments.content:
From the SAM Pro training (Software Request and Sourcing):

Service Catalog: Central listing of goods and services an organization provides - End users order from the Service Catalog.

Product Catalog: Collection of Models in the environment - models can be easily published to the Product Catalog and are then automatically published to the Service Catalog.

Vendor Catalog: Listing of goods available from a vendor - items in the Vendor Catalog link to models in the Product Catalog.

This one is confusing between Product and Service Catalogs. 

Product Catalog = "Listing of goods an organization provides."  https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/product-catalog/concept/c_ProductCatalog.html

Service Catalog = "Collection of Models in the environment" https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/service-catalog-management/concept/c_IntroductionToCatalogItems.html

This video really explains it: https://www.servicenow.com/community/training-and-certifications/service-catalog-administration-overview/ta-p/2297657

I found this blog/discussion to be helpful about Product and Service Catalog differences and uses: https://www.servicenow.com/community/now-platform-forum/service-catalog-items-vs-product-catalog-items-hardware-software/m-p/1058403
 
Vendor Catalog = "Listing of goods offered or available by a third party". This one is pretty clear.
replies:
I was so bothered by this one, I pressed on and Question #145 of this exam asks: "Which catalog provides a collection of models in the environment?" and the correct answer was "C.Product Catalog". 

Product Catalog, as it's a collection of models in the environment.

(it is not service catalog, as that is a listing of goods and services an organization provides.)

comments.content:
Product Catalog:The product catalog is a set of information about individual models
Service Catalog: create service catalogs that provide your customers with self-service opportunities
replies: True but this was not very helpful in identifying the answers for Product and Service Catalogs. This one was tricky!

Requests group all the items requested and associated records together in a single location. The structure of a software request includes:
The items that were requested.

questions.question: What is the purpose of an external audit?
answers: A. To ensure your users are not running any blacklisted software
B. To determine compliance with internally-defined vendor processes
C. To determine compliance with signed vendor agreements/contracts
D. To ensure your entitlements do not exceed your allocations
E. To determine compliance with licensing agreements regarding who, how, and when freeware software is being used

comments.content: C - correct answer

questions.question: Software Asset Lifecycle has __________ components.

comments.content:
sys_choice.list   of  table "sam_sw_product_lifecycle" for element "lifecycle_phase" contains:
pre_release
availability
upgrade
end_of_support
end_of_extended_support
end_of_life
Actually, the SAM on-Demand course speaks of "eight STAGES", so the question about "components"is misleading. Anyway, the answer is A - 8.

1. Plan
2. Request
3. Approve
4. Source
5. Allocate
6. Manage
7. Support
8. Sunset
